Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Suk Ho Moon, Senior Pastor: Hyoshin Bible Presbyterian Church, 42-15 166th Street, Flushing, NY  11358.
	
Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Liu.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Suk Ho Moon, Senior Pastor, Hyoshin Bible Presbyterian Church, 42-15 166th Street, Flushing, N.Y. 11358.

Council Member Liu moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 2, 2009 be adopted as printed by Council Member Rivera.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Rivera moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 2, 2009 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Communication from the Chancellor – Submitting the five-year educational facilities capital plan for 2010 – 2014.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Submitting the five-year educational facilities capital plan for 2010 – 2014.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Ferreras:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 090366 PCQ, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 130-31 Northern Boulevard for use as an asphalt plant.  (C090366PCQ)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Vacca:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 090249 PPX, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Block 3838/part of Lot 60, Bronx (C090249PPX)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Duane, S.4278, and Assembly Members Rosenthal and Kellner, A.6158-A, “AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a New York city animal population control program and an animal population control fund; and to amend chapter 115 of the laws of 1894 relating to the better protection of lost and strayed animals and for securing the rights of owners thereof, in relation to licensing fees.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a New York city animal population control program and an animal population control fund. (S.4278/A.6158-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Diaz, S.3163, and Assembly Member Arroyo, A.6053-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interests in certain real property accrued August 8, 1978 by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of the Bronx to Gardner Paige notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which applications may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 2347, Lot No. 12, on the tax map for the borough of the Bronx”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing NYC to reconvey its interests in certain real property accrued August 8, 1978 by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of the Bronx to Gardner Paige. (S.3163/A.6053-A)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring inspections of window guards in multiple dwellings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring inspections of window guards in multiple dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to hydrostatic pressure testing of standpipes and sprinklers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Hydrostatic pressure testing of standpipes and sprinklers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of sanitary toilet seat covers in public primary and secondary schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Provision of sanitary toilet seat covers in public primary and secondary schools.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Department of Education to establish its own air quality standards to ensure the health and safety of all public school children and staff.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to establish its own air quality standards to ensure the health and safety of all public school children and staff.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Duane, S.4278, and Assembly Members Rosenthal and Kellner, A.6158-A, “AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a New York city animal population control program and an animal population control fund; and to amend chapter 115 of the laws of 1894 relating to the better protection of lost and strayed animals and for securing the rights of owners thereof, in relation to licensing fees.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Establishing a New York city animal population control program and an animal population control fund. (S.4278/A.6158-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Diaz, S.3163, and Assembly Member Arroyo, A.6053-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interests in certain real property accrued August 8, 1978 by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of the Bronx to Gardner Paige notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which applications may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 2347, Lot No. 12, on the tax map for the borough of the Bronx”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Authorizing NYC to reconvey its interests in certain real property accrued August 8, 1978 by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of the Bronx to Gardner Paige. (S.3163/A.6053-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the City of New York to compensate the six men who were wrongly accused and incarcerated in the Central Park Jogger Case.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Compensate the six men who were wrongly accused and incarcerated in the Central Park Jogger Case.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to for-hire vehicle licenses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: For-hire vehicle licenses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to securing personal information privacy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology in Government
Items.MatterName: Securing personal information privacy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating open data standards.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology in Government
Items.MatterName: Creating open data standards.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to enact S.3514 and A.7369 of 2009, which authorize political subdivisions to award public competitively bid contracts to businesses that participate in programs designed to foster participation by small local businesses in public procurement at a cost premium not to exceed ten percent of the lowest bid.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Authorize political subdivisions to award public competitively bid contracts to businesses that participate in programs designed to foster participation by small local businesses. (S.3514/A.7369)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to residency requirements for city employees
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Residency requirements for city employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to submittal documents for demolition.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Submittal documents for demolition.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to requiring painting of dedicated standpipes and sprinklers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring painting of dedicated standpipes and sprinklers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disclosure of tenant screening reports.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Disclosure of tenant screening reports.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring city plantings to be storm water tolerant so as to facilitate storm water retention and filtration.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring city plantings to be storm water tolerant so as to facilitate storm water retention and filtration.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the release of construction site washout water from capital projects.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the release of construction site washout water from capital projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the concurrent performance of demolition work and asbestos abatement activities within the same building.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Concurrent performance of demolition work and asbestos abatement activities within the same building.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to site safety managers and coordinators.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Site safety managers and coordinators.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to cutting and capping of standpipes and sprinklers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Cutting and capping of standpipes and sprinklers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Commissioner of Housing and Community Renewal to amend the Rent Stabilization Code by creating a review process for rent increases for individual apartments based upon increased services, new equipment installation or improvements to an apartment, and change the structure of Major Capital Improvement and Individual Apartment Increases from being charged in perpetuity to being charged for only five years.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Amend the Rent Stabilization Code by creating a review process for rent increases for individual apartments based upon increased services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting smoking at abatement sites.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting smoking at abatement sites.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting smoking at construction sites.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting smoking at construction sites.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to enact legislation ensuring that the Energy Star Program remains the gold standard for energy efficient products.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Ensuring that the Energy Star Program remains the gold standard for energy efficient products.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt S.1646 and A. 5659,  legislation which would remove the December 31, 2009 sunset date in Timothy’s Law, and thereby make mental health parity under health insurance plans permanent in New York State.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Remove the December 31, 2009 sunset date in Timothy’s Law, and thereby make mental health parity under health insurance plans permanent in NYS. (S.1646/A.5659)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Education to bring its birthday cutoff date for admissions to kindergarten more in line with that of private schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to bring its birthday cutoff date for admissions to kindergarten more in line with that of private schools.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting President Barack Obama’s nomination of Judge Sonia Sotomayor to the Supreme Court of the United States, congratulating Judge Sotomayor on her nomination, and urging swift Senate confirmation.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Urging President Obama to appoint Sonia Sotomayor, a judge on the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, to the Supreme Court of the United States.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to asbestos abatement and repealing article 106 of chapter 1 of title 28 of the administrative code in relation thereto.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Asbestos abatement and repealing article 106 of chapter 1 of title 28 of the administrative code in relation thereto.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 179, the Community AIDS and Hepatitis Prevention Act, to lift the ban on federal funds for Syringe Exchange Programs to reduce the transmission of blood-borne pathogens, including HIV and viral hepatitis.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: H.R. 179, the Community AIDS and Hepatitis Prevention Act

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, the New York city building code and the New York city fire code, in relation to an air pressurized alarm system for standpipes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Air pressurized alarm system for standpipes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to egress at abatement projects.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Egress at abatement projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Mayor to submit reports concerning contracts for advertising space.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Mayor to submit reports concerning contracts for advertising space.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to pass legislation that would require New York State courts, prior to accepting a plea to a felony, misdemeanor or violation, to advise defendants of immigration consequences and that would also provide substantive remedies for defendants who plead guilty without knowledge of such consequences.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: NYS courts, prior to accepting a plea to a felony, misdemeanor or violation, to advise defendants of immigration consequences and that would also provide substantive remedies for defendants who plead guilty without knowledge of such consequences.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to inter-agency notification.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Inter-agency notification.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the issuance of building permits.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Issuance of building permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to fees for certain applications, appeals, filings and reviews processed and determined by the board of standards and appeals, and to repeal certain provisions of such code relating thereto.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Fees for certain applications, appeals, filings and reviews processed and determined by the board of standards and appeals, and to repeal certain provisions of such code relating thereto.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to agreements concerning performance of agency administrative functions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Agreements concerning performance of agency administrative functions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exemptions from the payment of fees for fire department permits, inspections and performance tests.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Exemptions from the payment of fees for fire department permits, inspections and performance tests.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the tax on the occupancy of hotel rooms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Tax on the occupancy of hotel rooms.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Fiscal 2009 Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding pursuant to the fiscal 2009 expense budget.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting new fast food service establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting new fast food service establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to regionally significant projects and empire zones.

Items.MatterName: Regionally significant projects and empire zones.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)

The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) on May 20, 2009.  

The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) was not present at this Meeting of May 20, 2009.
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

Editor's Note: The revised LU Call-up vote was 51-0-0 as shown above (the original vote on May 20, 2009 was 49-0-0).  Please see the Editor's Note re: revised Attendance and Voting printed after the Roll Call for Attendance in these Minutes.

Items.MinutesNote: Editor's Note:    * Editor's Note re: revised Attendance and Voting for the Stated Meeting held on May 20, 2009:  The Stated Council Meeting of May 20, 2009 opened on May 20, 2009 and was adjourned after brief proceedings on June 10, 2009 (shortly before the start of the regularly scheduled Stated Council Meeting of June 10, 2009) .  Though not present on May 20, 2009, Council Members Comrie and White were present at the Recessed Meeting of May 20, 2009 held on June 10, 2009 and are, therefore, considered present for attendance and voting purposes for the Stated Council Meeting of May 20, 2009.  Council Members Comrie and White chose to cast an affirmative vote on June 10, 2009 for the items coupled on the Land Use Call-up and General Order Calendars of  this Stated Council Meeting held on May 20, 2009 (please see Land Use Call-up vote and General Order votes printed in these Minutes of the Stated Council Meeting of May 20, 2009).

Editor's Note: The revised Genera Order vote was 51-0-0 as shown above (the original General Order vote on May 20, 2009 was 49-0-0).  Please see the Editor's Note re: revised Attendance and Voting printed after the Roll Call for Attendance in these Minutes.
